009
010package imagingbook.lib.image.access;
011
012import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.lib.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
015
016// TODO: make ImageAccessor vector-valued by default, eliminate VectorAccessor alltogether?
017
018
019/**
020 * This abstract class provides unified image access to all 4 types of images available in ImageJ:
021 * 8-bit, 16-bit, float, and color images.
022 * It is used as a wrapper around an instance of ImageJ's {@link ImageProcessor} type.
023 * <br>
024 * A generic {@link ImageAccessor} is created, e.g., by {@link #create(ImageProcessor)}, which
025 * returns an instance of {@link ByteAccessor}, {@link ShortAccessor}, {@link FloatAccessor} or
026 * {@link RgbAccessor}.
027 * {@link ImageAccessor} itself can access any ImageJ image using 
028 * the methods {@link #getPix(int, int)}, {@link #getPix(double, double)}
029 * for retrieving pixel values and {@link #setPix(int, int, float[])}
030 * to modify pixel values.
031 * All pixel values are of type {@code float[]}, either containing a single element (for
032 * scalar-valued images) or three elements (for color images).
033 * <br>
034 * In addition, the accessors for scalar-valued images ({@link ByteAccessor}, {@link ShortAccessor},
035 * {@link FloatAccessor}) provide the methods
036 * {@link ScalarAccessor#getVal(int, int)}, {@link ScalarAccessor#getVal(double, double)} and 
037 * {@link ScalarAccessor#setVal(int, int, float)}
038 * to read and write scalar-valued pixels passed as single {@code float} values.
039 * <br>
040 * The methods {@link #getPix(double, double)} and {@link ScalarAccessor#getVal(double, double)} perform interpolation at non-integer coordinates
041 * using the specified {@link InterpolationMethod}.
042 * <br>
043 * See {@link imagingbook.lib.filters.GenericFilter} 
044 * and {@code Pixel_Interpolation.Interpolator_Demo} (in {@code imagingbook-plugins-all}) for a concrete usage examples.
045 * 
046 * @author W. Burger
047 * @version 2020/12/27
048 */
049public abstract class ImageAccessor {
050        
051        static final OutOfBoundsStrategy DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy = OutOfBoundsStrategy.DefaultValue;
052        static final InterpolationMethod DefaultInterpolationMethod = InterpolationMethod.Bilinear;
053        
054        protected final ImageProcessor ip;
055        protected final int width;
056        protected final int height;
057        protected final PixelIndexer indexer;           // implements the specified OutOfBoundsStrategy
058        protected final OutOfBoundsStrategy outOfBoundsStrategy;
059        protected final InterpolationMethod interpolationMethod;
060        
061        /**
062         * Creates a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance for the given image,
063         * using the default out-of-bounds strategy and interpolation method.
064         * The concrete type of the returned instance depends on the specified image
065         * 
066         * @param ip the source image
067         * @return a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance
068         */
069        public static final ImageAccessor create(ImageProcessor ip) {
070                return create(ip, DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy, DefaultInterpolationMethod);
071        }
072        
073        /**
074         * Convenience method.
075         * Creates a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance for the given image,
076         * using the specified out-of-bounds strategy and interpolation method.
077         * The concrete type of the returned instance depends on the specified image
078         * 
079         * @param ip the source image
080         * @param obs the out-of-bounds strategy (use {@code null} for default settings)
081         * @param ipm the interpolation method (use {@code null} for default settings)
082         * @return a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance
083         */
084        public static ImageAccessor create(ImageProcessor ip,  OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
085                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
086                        return new RgbAccessor((ColorProcessor)ip, obs, ipm);
087                }
088                else {
089                        return ScalarAccessor.create(ip, obs, ipm);
090                }
091        }
092        
093        // constructor (used by all subtypes)
094        protected ImageAccessor(ImageProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
095                this.ip = ip;
096                this.width  = ip.getWidth();
097                this.height = ip.getHeight();
098                this.outOfBoundsStrategy = (obs != null) ? obs : DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy;
099                this.interpolationMethod = (ipm != null) ? ipm : DefaultInterpolationMethod;
100                this.indexer = PixelIndexer.create(width, height, this.outOfBoundsStrategy);
101        }
102        
103        public int getWidth() {
104                return this.width;
105        }
106        
107        public int getHeight() {
108                return this.height;
109        }
110        
111        /**
112         * Returns the source {@link ImageProcessor} associated with this
113         * {@link ImageAccessor}.
114         * 
115         * @return the image processor
116         */
117        public ImageProcessor getProcessor() {
118                return this.ip;
119        }
120        
121        public abstract int getDepth();
122        
123        /**
124         * Returns the {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy} specified for this
125         * {@link ImageAccessor}.
126         * 
127         * @return the out-of-bounds strategy
128         */
129        public OutOfBoundsStrategy getOutOfBoundsStrategy() {
130                return outOfBoundsStrategy;
131        }
132
133        /**
134         * Returns the {@link InterpolationMethod} specified for this
135         * {@link ImageAccessor}.
136         * 
137         * @return the interpolation method
138         */
139        public InterpolationMethod getInterpolationMethod() {
140                return interpolationMethod;
141        }
142        
143        /**
144         * Returns pixel value at the specified integer position as a
145         * {@code float[]} with either 1 element for scalar-valued images
146         * or 3 elements for RGB images.
147         * @param u the x-coordinate
148         * @param v the y-coordinate
149         * @return the pixel value ({@code float[]})
150         */
151        public abstract float[] getPix(int u, int v);
152        
153        /**
154         * Returns pixel value at the specified floating-point position as a
155         * {@code float[]} with either 1 for scalar-valued images
156         * and or 3 elements for RGB images.
157         * Interpolation is used non-integer coordinates.
158         * 
159         * @param x the x-coordinate
160         * @param y the y-coordinate
161         * @return the interpolated pixel value ({@code float[]})
162         */
163        public abstract float[] getPix(double x, double y);             // returns interpolated pixel value at real position (x, y)
164        
165        /**
166         * Sets the pixel value at the specified integer position.
167         * The new value must be provided as {@code float[]} with 
168         * 1 element for scalar-valued images or 3 elements for RGB images.
169         * @param u the x-coordinate
170         * @param v the y-coordinate
171         * @param val the new pixel value ({@code float[]})
172         */
173        public abstract void setPix(int u, int v, float[] val);
174        
175        /**
176         * Returns the value of the pixel's k-th component at the
177         * specified position. If the associated image is scalar-valued,
178         * this is equivalent to component 0.
179         * See also {@link #getDepth()}.
180         * 
181         * @param u the x-coordinate
182         * @param v the y-coordinate
183         * @param k the component index
184         * @return the component value ({@code float})
185         */
186        public abstract float getVal(int u, int v, int k);
187        
188        
189        /**
190         * Returns the interpolated value of the pixel's k-th component at the
191         * specified position. If the associated image is scalar-valued,
192         * this is equivalent to component 0.
193         * See also {@link #getDepth()}.
194         * 
195         * @param x the x-coordinate
196         * @param y the y-coordinate
197         * @param k the component index
198         * @return the interpolated component value ({@code float[]})
199         */
200        public abstract float getVal(double x, double y, int k);
201        
202        /**
203         * Sets the value of the pixel's k-th component at the
204         * specified position. If the associated image is scalar-valued,
205         * this is equivalent to component 0.
206         * See also {@link #getDepth()}.
207         * 
208         * @param u the x-coordinate
209         * @param v the y-coordinate
210         * @param k the component index
211         * @param val the new component value
212         */
213        public abstract void setVal(int u, int v, int k, float val);
214        
215        public abstract ScalarAccessor getComponentAccessor(int k);
216        
217        public abstract void setDefaultValue(float val);
218        public abstract void setDefaultValue(float[] vals);
219        
220}
